item.title: Sudoless Kicksecure
item.dc:creator: @ike
item.description:
Patrick:

It’s probably not needed but you’d need to be a very advanced user to understand, change the source code.

It’s not worth pursuing unless there is considerable interest in going sudoless with no root logins allowed (except rescue boots). I’m new here, so I don’t have any idea how much interest there is on this. As an alternative, I noticed that kicksecure puts in protections against brute-forcing passwords. But is there anything kicksecure adds that prevents X key loggers? I don’t know of any such tech short of using wayland with xwayland disabled. But, IMHO wayland environments don’t (yet) provide the stability of X running some tried-and-true window manager. So, if using X, going passwordless is a better way to prevent password attacks.

item.title: Add/Remove Extra Packages
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
nurmagoz:

Add Atril or Xpdf as local pdf reader.

Done xpdf.

nurmagoz:

Add Hexchat as IRC client

Waiting for more user requests.

nurmagoz:

Add PGA as graphical PGP generator

Done for gpa.

nurmagoz:

Add hunspell-en-us as english dictionary

Done.

nurmagoz:

Add youtube-dl […]

Done.

nurmagoz:

Add anon-connection-wizard to control Tor connection in graphical way

That would be nice but anon-connection-wizard isn’t compatible with Kicksecure yet. Help welcome.

nurmagoz:
  • zulucrypt-gui for local encryption of folders and files (exist in kicksecure-metapackages but not installed by default)

Meta package non-qubes-vm-enhancements-gui Depend: on it. So it’s installed by default in Kicksecure. But not in Kicksecure for Qubes. That’s on purpose. In Qubes, device encryption would be handled differently and no device would be attached directly to a Kicksecure based Qube? Seems a pretty specific use case. In which case, it would be up to the user to set that up

Waiting for more user requests.

nurmagoz:

Remove:

  • codecrypt as its dead/deprecated

Answered here:

Whonix Forum – 5 Nov 22

post-quantum cryptography - PQC

Why? Is its main functionality or cryptography broken?

github.com/Kicksecure/kicksecure-meta-packages

install more packages by default

committed 01:29PM - 05 Nov 22 UTC
adrelanos
+5 -5

- hunspell-en-us - gpa - ffmpeg - pinentry-qt (or pinentry-x11) - pdf - youtube-…dl https://forums.kicksecure.com/t/add-remove-extra-packages/135/4

item.title: Add/Remove Extra Packages
item.dc:creator: @nurmagoz
item.description:
Add:

  • Add Atril or Xpdf as local pdf reader.
  • Add Hexchat as IRC client
  • Add PGA as graphical PGP generator
  • Add hunspell-en-us as english dictionary
  • Add youtube-dl for downloading youtube and other websites videos
  • Add anon-connection-wizard to control Tor connection in graphical way
  • zulucrypt-gui for local encryption of folders and files (exist in kicksecure-metapackages but not installed by default)

Remove:

  • codecrypt as its dead/deprecated

item.title: Remove/Replace broken links at kicksecure.com
item.dc:creator: @nurmagoz
item.description:
If we view the source code of https://www.kicksecure.com/ page there are:

1- Search for forums.kicksecure.org

<a href="https://forums.kicksecure.org" data-modal="modal-explain-community" target="_blank">

there is no kicksecure.org, it should be .com

2- Search for https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1180410

<a target="_blank" class="external text" href="https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1180410">
  de-anonymization of Tor onion services

URL broken/changed, check if it can be replaced entirely or with archive one.

3- There is no anbox homepage for anbox-kicksecure feature

Kicksecure – 4 Nov 22

Anbox

4- /wiki/Verify_the_Whonix_images → https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Verify_the_Whonix_images → Doesnt exist

  <p>
    Downloads are
    <a href="/wiki/Verifying_Software_Signatures">signed</a>
    so genuine Whonix releases can be
    <a href="/wiki/Verify_the_Whonix_images">verified</a>.
  </p>

item.dc:creator: @Patrick

Remove wget since its not upstream default and less secure than curl (kicksecure support scurl),

Done.

VLC media player.

Done.

nurmagoz:

Thunderbird.

Not sure. Encrypted Email with Thunderbird is complete but no documentation exists for Thunderbird in Kicksecure at time of writing.

Kicksecure – 24 Jul 22

Email Overview

Waiting if there will be high demand for this one which I doubt.

item.title: Sudoless Kicksecure
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error

However, it implies that maybe sudo isn’t needed after installation.

It’s probably not needed but you’d need to be a very advanced user to understand, change the source code.

ike:

As long as that is put in place first and tested, is there a remaining fear of admin lockout?

It’s untested and at time of writing there’s no CI test yet to make sure the recovery mode is always functional either.

Kicksecure – 1 Sep 22

Undocumented, Untested or Unsupported Features

This feature is either undocumented, untested, or unsupported. Options: Become a Contributor / Apply Free Support Principle / Purchase Professional Support.

Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error

Also, on the topic of sudo: has anyone doing kicksecure devo thought about a lighter weight and potentially more secure alternative, like siduction’s doas command?

No contributor was ever working on it and it’s not on the roadmap.

Bug Reports, Software Development and Feature Requests chapter Community Feedback in Kicksecure wiki applies.

item.title: Clean Installing KS On Debian 11 CLI, Hit Security Misc Error
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description: 5 posts were split to a new topic: Sudoless Kicksecure

item.title: Sudoless Kicksecure
item.dc:creator: @ike
item.description: Oh - kicksecure already has that SYSTEMD_SULOGIN_FORCE dropin file (named override.conf - but the name doesn’t matter). As long as that is put in place first and tested, is there a remaining fear of admin lockout?

item.title: Sudoless Kicksecure
item.dc:creator: @ike
item.description:
I did the grep through the sources.
It points primarily to:

Whonix Forum – 16 Oct 19

Is security-misc suitable for hardening bridges and relays?

Hello both and thanks for your kind replies. Apologies for the late answer but I have been kind of busy today. Well, I tried to install security-misc on a private relay I am running for testing purposes. After the reboot when I tried to become root...

which implies that sudo is there as a way to make sure that the installation of kicksecure doesn’t result in admin lockout. That’s a good reason. However, it implies that maybe sudo isn’t needed after installation.
Unfortunately, there are many other uses of sudo in the sources. It isn’t clear to me whether they are for convenience purposes or required.

As for requiring sudo to prevent admin lockout during install: another way would be to make sure that root logins in rescue mode always happen, even if root is otherwise locked. This can be done with a single dropin file:

mkdir -p /etc/systemd/system/rescue.service.d
cat >/etc/systemd/system/rescue.service.d/force-root.conf <<EOF
[Service]
Environment=SYSTEMD_SULOGIN_FORCE=yes
EOF

Then require that the rest of the install of kicksecure be done in rescue mode (probably safer anyway).

Also, on the topic of sudo: has anyone doing kicksecure devo thought about a lighter weight and potentially more secure alternative, like siduction’s doas command? Personally, I’d like to do away with any way to change from one user to another (or root), but I understand that’s not a universal taste.

item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:

item.title: Enabling open-link-confirmation
item.dc:creator: @Patrick
item.description:
This one (which was posted later) could be a duplicate:

Not having a default browser and pressing on "Web Browser" icon in xfce will give annoying bug Development
Since we dont have a default browser by default so any user who is morphing debian fresh install he will not have a browser as well (specially debian minimal version like netinst or CD…etc). This will give annoying show annoying bug: [havingnobrowser1] Will show a bug window which you need to press on OK multiple times to disappear: 1 [havingnobrowser2] 2 [havingnobrowser3] 3 [havingnobrowser4] 4 [havingnobrowser5] 5 [havingnobrowser6]

For solution, could you please have a look here?

Add pyqt5-dev-tool dependency to kicksecure dependencies Development
Root cause is that meta package kicksecure-desktop-applications-recommended isn’t installed. That package would ensure that the dependency package repository-dist-wizard gets installed. I’ve updated the installation instructions just now: Here’s the change: Debian: Difference between revisions - Kicksecure

In short: the documentation on which meta package to install has been updated.
